description.value: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0119 ( Order Control Codes)

valueString.value:
Placer Applications.

AF is a response to RF where the placer authorizing a refill or quantity of refills.

Placer or Filler Applications.

A cancellation is a request by the placer for the filler, or the filler to the placer, not to do a previously ordered service. Confirmation of the cancellation request is provided by the filler or placer, e.g. a message w

Placer or Filler Applications.

Used in conjunction with the PA - Parent order control code. Refer to PA order control code for discussion.

Filler Applications.

The combined result code provides a mechanism to transmit results that are associated with two or more orders. This situation occurs commonly in radiology reports when the radiologist dictates a single report for two or more exams r

Filler Applications.

The control code CP - Cancel process step should be used in the ORC-1 for communication Filler-to-Filler, e.g. LIS-to-Analyzer, to differentiate from code CA (Placer-to-Filler).

The Filler should response with an acceptance of th

Filler or Placer Applications.

A response by the filler or placer application that a request to cancel (CA by the placer application) was performed successfully.

Placer or Filler Applications.

A request by the placer for the filler, or the filler to the placer, to discontinue a previously requested service. The differentiation between discontinue and cancel is that discontinue effects the order/service and all
Placer or Filler Applications.

Placer Applications.

In response to a Filler application requesting refill authorization (RF), DF indicates that the placer does not authorize refills for the order. ORC-16 Order Control Code reason may be used to indicate the reason for the request den

Filler or Placer Applications.

The filler or placer, in response to a request to discontinue (DC from the placer or filler application), has discontinued the order/service.

Filler Applications.

FU notifies the placer that the filler issued a refill for the order at the patient's request.

Placer Applications.

Typical responses include, but are not limited to, CR - Cancelled as requested, UC - Unable to Cancel.
Filler Applications.

Placer or Filler Applications.

Refer to Chapter 12 Patient Care for complete discussion.

display.value: Link order/service to patient care problem or goal

value.value: Koppel aanvraag/service aan patiënt zorgprobleem of doel

valueString.value: applies to DFT^P03^DFT_P03 and DFT^P11^DFT_P11

display.value: Miscellaneous Charge - not associated with an order

value.value: Overige charge - niet gekoppeld aan een aanvraag

valueString.value:
Placer Applications.

There are three circumstances that involve requesting an order number (ORC-2-placer order number or ORC-3-filler order number):

(1) When the filler application needs to request an ORC-3-filler order number from a centralized appli

Placer Applications.

See comments for NA - Number Assigned.
Filler Applications.
Filler Applications.
Filler Applications.

Filler Applications.

OF directly responds to the placer system's request for a refill.
Filler Applications.

Filler Applications.

See comments for NA - Number Assigned.

Placer Applications.

These order control codes are used to communicate an order between systems where the order is intended for informational purposes. For example, an order that will be performed by a vendor outside the enterprise of communicating syst

display.value: Notification of order for outside dispense

value.value: Notificatie van aanvraag voor verstrekking door derde

valueString.value: Filler Applications.

Filler Applications.

The parent (PA) and child (CH) order control codes allow the spawning of "child" orders from a "parent" order without changing the parent (original order). One or more ORC segments with an ORC-1-order control value of PA are followe

Placer Applications.

PR indicates that this ORC is part of an ORU structure containing previous observation, which is embedded in the order.

At least two main use cases require that the complete results of the previous observations be transmitted with

Placer Applications.

See comments for OP - Notification of order for outside dispense.

display.value: Notification of replacement order for outside dispense

value.value: Notificatie van vervangende aanvraag voor verstrekking door derde

valueString.value:
Placer or Filler Applications.

The observations-to-follow code is used to transmit patient-specific information with an order. An order detail segment (e.g. OBR) can be followed by one or more observation segments (OBX). Any observation that can be tra

value.value: Untersuchungsergebnisse folgen (in späteren Segmenten dieser Nachricht)

valueString.value:
Placer or Filler Applications.

RF accommodates requests by either the filler or the placer. The filler may be requesting refill authorization from the placer. A placer system may be requesting a refill to be done by the filler system.

Typical response
Placer Applications.

Placer or Filler Applications.

A replacement is the substitution of one or more orders for one or more previously ordered services.

The replaced orders are treated as though they were canceled. If and when an ordered service can be replaced are local

Placer Applications.

A replacement is the substitution of one or more orders for one or more previously ordered services. See comment 1 on RO - Replacement Order for further discussion.

The order replace request code permits the order filler to replac

Filler Applications.

A replacement is the substitution of one or more orders for one or more previously ordered services. See comment 1 on RO - Replacement Order for further discussion.

The order replace request code permits the order filler to replac

Placer or Filler Applications.

Left in for backward compatibility. In the current version it is equivalent to an accept acknowledgment. The request-received code indicates that an order message has been received and will be processed later. The order ha

Filler Applications.

A replacement is the substitution of one or more orders for one or more previously ordered services. See comment 1 on RO - Replacement Order for further discussion.

The unsolicited replacement code permits the filler application t
Placer or Filler Applications.

Placer Applications.

See comments for NA - Number Assigned.
Filler Applications.

display.value: Response to send order/service status request

value.value: Antwoord op stuur aanvraag/service status verzoek

valueString.value: Placer Applications.

Filler Applications.

An unable-to-accept code is used when a new order cannot be accepted by the filler. Possible reasons include requesting a prescription for a drug which the patient is allergic to or for an order which requires certain equipment reso

Filler or Placer Applications.

An unable-to-cancel code is used when the ordered service is at a point that it cannot be canceled by the placer or filler or when local rules prevent cancellation by the filler. The use of this code is dependent on the va

Filler or Placer Applications.

An unable-to-discontinue code is used when the ordered service is at a point that it cannot be discontinued by the placer or filler or when local rules prevent discontinuance by the filler. The use of this code is dependen

Filler Applications.

Negative response to RF Refill order/service request, indicating that the receiving application was not able to complete the refill request.
Filler Applications.
Filler Applications.

Placer or Filler Applications.

Refer to Chapter 12 Patient Care for complete discussion.
